articles.title: America's Cup: Deed of gift challenge doesn't sit comfortably with all British yachting faithful - Stuff.co.nz
articles.description: "The sense that buying the America's Cup is a somewhat vulgar expression of opportunism is prevalent in many" is the mood as racing finally resumes in Covid-hit Cowes.
articles.content:
It seems a deed of gift America's Cup challenge between Team New Zealand and Team UK on the Solent doesnt sit comfortably with all the yachting die-hards in Britain.

articles.author: Nate Rattner
articles.title: CDC director says hospitalizations among seniors are declining as more than half of the age group is fully vaccinated - CNBC
articles.description: More than half of Americans 65 and older are fully vaccinated, and emergency department visits and hospitalizations associated with that age group are falling.
articles.content: As the U.S. continues to increase the pace of its vaccination campaign, now averaging more than 3 million shots per day, those in the most vulnerable age group are leading the way. About 75% of Ameri… [+2836 chars]

articles.author: Jon Porter
articles.title: TikTok adds automatic captions to videos in accessibility push - The Verge
articles.description: TikTok creators will soon be able to add automatically generated captions to their videos. The option will appear in a video’s editing page and will be available in American English and Japanese to start.
articles.content:
Launching in American English and Japanese first
Creators will have the option of editing captions once theyve been generated.
Image: TikTok

articles.author: William Cooper
articles.title: Commentary: Unusual, enormous bigotry has been long directed at Asian-Americans - CNA
articles.description: Problematic attitudes towards Asian-Americans and the rise of more explicit forms of racism suggest a rethinking in America’s race relations is long overdue, says commentator William Cooper.
